item.title: Eat more beans. Please.
item.description: Beans are high in protein, efficient to grow, and can even improve soil health. They cost less than conventional or new plant-based meats, and they’re increasingly getting attention among foodies.

item.title: Unpacking the Myths of Drilling in MMA, BJJ, and Kickboxing: Understanding Ecological Dynamics
item.description: The world of martial arts has been long dominated by the belief that repetitive drilling leads to perfected techniques and muscle memory. However, this conventional wisdom is often contradicted by research and practices in the dynamic and complex sports of MMA, BJJ, and Kickboxing. In this article, we'll delve into the key myths surrounding drilling and explore the ecological dynamics that shape the way we learn and perform in these sports. item.description: After more than three years, COVID public health emergencies at the federal level and in Massachusetts come to an end Thursday. Here's what will change with testing, masking, vaccination and more.

NPR quits Twitter after being falsely labeled as 'state-affiliated media'
item.description: NPR's official Twitter feeds have gone silent. The news organization cites the social media platform's decision to question NPR's editorial independence through a series of inaccurate labels.
